summary: Build a website called "Troll Tower 6 Codes" featuring a "Get Codes!" button that opens a short yes/no questionnaire and reveals a "Here Is Some Codes!" button only if the user answers "Yes" to all questions; clicking it shows three code buttons: "Sub2AcerXDucky = 4500 Money", "FunTrollTower6 = 3000 Money", and "ILoveTT6 = 1200 Money".

existing_features.title: Create a single-page website titled "Troll Tower 6 Codes" with a prominent primary button labeled "Get Codes!" on the main screen.

When the user clicks "Get Codes!", display a 2-question yes/no questionnaire in this order: (1) "Do you subscribe to AcerXDucky?" with options "Yes" and "No"; (2) "Do you play Troll Tower 6?" with options "Yes" and "No".

Gate access to the final action: show a button labeled "Here Is Some Codes!" only after the user has answered "Yes" to both questions; if any answer is "No", the "Here Is Some Codes!" button must not appear.

Apply a coherent, playful "troll tower" visual theme consistently across the page (e.g., stone/dungeon-inspired neutrals with a neon-green accent), including typography, spacing, and button styling; avoid using a blue/purple primary palette.

After the user answers "Yes" to both questionnaire questions, show a final action button labeled "Get Some Codes" (English text). When the user clicks this button, display three buttons with the exact labels: "Sub2AcerXDucky = 4500 Money", "FunTrollTower6 = 3000 Money", and "ILoveTT6 = 1200 Money".

new_feature_requests.summary: Add a "Get Codes!" button that starts the questions flow
Implement 2-question yes/no questionnaire: "Do u Subscibe To AcerXDucky?" and "Do You Play Troll Tower 6?"
Show "Here Is Some Codes!" button only when user answers Yes to all questions
After clicking the final "Here Is Some Codes!" / "Get Some Codes" action, display 3 buttons with code+reward: Sub2AcerXDucky=4500 Money, FunTrollTower6=3000 Money, ILoveTT6=1200 Money
